00039 static float average(const vector<float> &data)
00040 {
00041         double sum = 0;
00042         int n = (int)data.size();
00043         for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00044                 sum += data[i];
00045         return (float) (sum / n);
00046 }
00047 
00048 static float percentile(const vector<float> &data, int percentile)
00049 {
00050         if (data.size() == 0)
00051                 return numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
00052     double dindex = percentile * ((data.size()-1) / 100.0f);
00053     int index = (int) (dindex + 0.5f);
00054         if (abs(dindex - index) <= numeric_limits<float>::epsilon())
00055         return data[index];
00056     else
00057         return (data[index-1] + data[index])/2;
00058 }

00062 TwoPointNormalizationEngine * TwoPointNormalizationEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00063 {
00064         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == TwoPointNormalizationEngine::EngineName())
00065                 return (TwoPointNormalizationEngine *)engine;
00066         return NULL;
00067 }

00079 void TwoPointNormalizationEngine::defineOptions()
00080 {
00081         defineOption("", "in-summary-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00082                 "Text file specifying the summary data.",
00083                 "");
00084         defineOption("", "in-count-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00085                 "Text file specifying the count data.",
00086                 "");
00087         defineOption("", "marker-content-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00088                 "Text file specifying the mix file.",
00089                 "");
00090         defineOption("", "out-summary-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00091                 "Text file specifying the summary data.",
00092                 "");
00093         defineOption("", "percentile", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00094                 "The percentile value to calculate.",
00095                 "50");
00096         defineOption("", "neg-control-target", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00097                 "The negative control target.",
00098                 "575");
00099         defineOption("", "target", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00100                 "The non-negative control target.",
00101                 "800");
00102         defineOption("", "type-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00103                 "The column name for the type.",
00104         "Type");
00105         defineOption("", "note-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00106                 "The column name for the note.",
00107         "Note");
00108         defineOption("", "probe-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00109                 "The column name for the probe id.",
00110         "Probe Id");
00111         defineOption("", "min-particle-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00112                 "The minimum particle count.",
00113                 "10");
00114 }

00118 /**
00119  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00120  */
00121 void TwoPointNormalizationEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00122 {
00123         string file;
00124         file = getOpt("in-summary-file");
00125         if (file.empty() == true)
00126                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input summary file.");
00127         file = getOpt("in-count-file");
00128         if (file.empty() == true)
00129                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input count file.");
00130         file = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00131         if (file.empty() == true)
00132                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input marker file.");
00133         file = getOpt("out-summary-file");
00134         if (file.empty() == true)
00135                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output summary file.");
00136 }
00137 
00138 void TwoPointNormalizationEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out)
00139 {
00140         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00141         getOptionNames(option_names);
00142         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00143         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00144         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00145         {
00146                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00147                 {
00148                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00149                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00150                         break;
00151                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00152                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00153                         break;
00154                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00155                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00156                         break;
00157                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00158                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00159                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00160                 }
00161         }
00162 }
00163 
00164 /**
00165    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00166 */
00167 void TwoPointNormalizationEngine::runImp()
00168 {
00169         string inFile = getOpt("in-summary-file");
00170         string countFile = getOpt("in-count-file");
00171         string mixFile = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00172         string outFile = getOpt("out-summary-file");
00173         int perc = getOptInt("percentile");
00174         int negTarget = getOptInt("neg-control-target");
00175         int target = getOptInt("target");
00176         int minCount = getOptInt("min-particle-count");
00177 
00178         // Open the mix file and store those negative type entries.
00179         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00180         if(tsv.open(mixFile) != TSV_OK)
00181                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + mixFile);
00182         tsv.rewind();
00183         map<string, bool> controlMap;
00184         int typeValue;
00185         string note;
00186         string id;
00187         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("type-col"), &typeValue, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00188         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("note-col"), &note, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00189         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00190         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00191         {
00192                 if (typeValue < 0)
00193                 {
00194                         if (id.empty() == true)
00195                                 id = note;
00196                         controlMap[id] = true;
00197                 }
00198         }
00199         tsv.clear();
00200 
00201         // Open the input summary and count files
00202         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00203         if(tsv.open(inFile) != TSV_OK)
00204                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + inFile);
00205         tsv.rewind();
00206         if(countTsv.open(countFile) != TSV_OK)
00207                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFile);
00208         countTsv.rewind();
00209 
00210         // Get the column names and save to the output file.
00211         ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00212         writeHeader(out);
00213         string name;
00214         int n = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00215         for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00216         {
00217                 name = tsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00218                 out << name;
00219                 if (i < n - 1)
00220                         out << "\t";
00221         }
00222         out << endl;
00223 
00224         // Allocate a vector of data for the row and bind to the columns.
00225         vector<double> data(n-1);
00226         vector<int> count(n-1);
00227         tsv.bind(0, 0, &name, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00228         for (int i=1; i<n; i++)
00229         {
00230                 tsv.bind(0, i, &data[i-1],  TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00231                 countTsv.bind(0, i, &count[i-1],  TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00232         }
00233 
00234         // Get the data. Separate the control from non-control values.
00235         // Only retrieve the counts for the controls.
00236         vector<string> names;
00237         vector<vector<float> > sampleData(n-1); 
00238         vector<vector<float> > controlData(n-1); 
00239         vector<vector<int> > countData(n-1);  
00240         vector<vector<int> > nonControlCountData(n-1); 
00241         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00242         {
00243                 countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00244                 bool isControl = (controlMap.find(name) != controlMap.end());
00245                 if (isControl == false)
00246                         names.push_back(name);
00247                 for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00248                 {
00249                         if (isControl == true)
00250                         {
00251                                 controlData[i].push_back(data[i]);
00252                                 countData[i].push_back(count[i]);
00253                         }
00254                         else
00255                         {
00256                                 sampleData[i].push_back(data[i]);
00257                                 nonControlCountData[i].push_back(count[i]);
00258                         }
00259                 }
00260         }
00261         data.erase(data.begin(), data.end());
00262         count.erase(count.begin(), count.end());
00263         tsv.clear();
00264         countTsv.clear();
00265 
00266         // Compute the weighted average of the controls and the
00267         // percentile of the non-controls.
00268         vector<float> wavg(n-1);
00269         vector<float> percentiles(n-1);
00270         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00271         {
00272                 vector<float> temp;
00273                 for (int j=0; j<(int)nonControlCountData[i].size(); j++)
00274                 {
00275                         if (nonControlCountData[i][j] >= minCount)
00276                                 temp.push_back(sampleData[i][j]);
00277                 }
00278                 std::sort(temp.begin(), temp.end());
00279                 percentiles[i] = percentile(temp, perc);
00280                 wavg[i] = 0;
00281                 int totalCount = 0;
00282                 for (int j=0; j<(int)controlData[i].size(); j++)
00283                 {
00284                         totalCount += countData[i][j];
00285                         wavg[i] += (controlData[i][j] * countData[i][j]);
00286                 }
00287                 if (totalCount > 0)
00288                         wavg[i] /= totalCount;
00289         }
00290         float avgPercentiles = target; //average(percentiles);
00291         float avgControl = negTarget; //average(wavg);
00292 
00293         // Compute the slope and intercept for each sample.
00294         vector<float> slope(n-1);
00295         vector<float> intercept(n-1);
00296         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00297         {
00298                 slope[i] = (avgPercentiles - avgControl) / (percentiles[i] - wavg[i]);
00299                 intercept[i] = avgControl - (slope[i] * wavg[i]);
00300         }
00301 
00302         // Output the normalized signals
00303         // If there is not data then output a zero.
00304         int nrows = (int) names.size();
00305         for (int j=0; j<nrows; j++)
00306         {
00307                 out << names[j];
00308                 for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00309                 {
00310                         out << "\t";
00311                         if (sampleData[i].empty() == false)
00312                         {
00313                                 if (nonControlCountData[i][j] > 0)
00314                                         out << (sampleData[i][j] * slope[i]) + intercept[i];
00315                                 else
00316                                         out << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00317                         }
00318                         else
00319                                 out << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00320                 }
00321                 out << endl;
00322         }
00323 
00324         // Close the files
00325         out.close();
00326 }
